description:
Aldo asked:"I am quite new to python and trying to 
convert my old IDL scripts. In particular I'm interested in 
cross-correlating source catalogs: is anything already publicly 
available on this problem?"To get this started, I'll comment that I think the poster is looking for cross-correlation based on positional separation (match within 1 arcsec).   I do not know of a full fledged script but among the coordinate resources listed at astropython.org, I was able to easily calculate angular separations using the astLib and coords packages.# using astLib from astLib.astCoords import calcAngSepDeg as gcirctheta1c = [83.81860444,-5.38969611]theta1b = [83.817270,-5.3853220]print '\nastLib.astCoords'print gcirc(*theta1c+theta1b),'degrees'print gcirc(*theta1c+theta1b)*3600.,'arcsec'print gcirc(*theta1c+theta1b)*3600. < 20.# Results:# astLib.astCoords# 0.00457141885429 degrees# 16.4571078754 arcsec# True# using coordsimport coordsprint '\ncoords'ptheta1c = coords.Position(tuple(theta1c))ptheta1b = coords.Position(tuple(theta1b))print ptheta1c.angsep(ptheta1b)print ptheta1c.angsep(ptheta1b).arcsec(),'arcsec'print ptheta1c.within(ptheta1b,20,units='arcsec')# Results# coords# 0.004571 degrees# 16.4571078405 arcsec# Trueprint '\ncompare'print gcirc(*theta1c+theta1b)*3600.,ptheta1c.angsep(ptheta1b).arcsec()print 'delta: ', gcirc(*theta1c+theta1b)*3600.-ptheta1c.angsep(ptheta1b).arcsec()# Results# compare# 16.4571078754 16.4571078405# delta: 3.49091848761e-08
title: [Question] Cross-matching in python?
